page.title: 05THE CAMP
page.content: The camp was opened in 1960 by{Her {Majesty the Queen.}The Junior Soldiers who live in the camp are from the Prince of Wales Division. The camp is an Infantry Depot where the soldiers train to use rifles. There are 325 Junior Soldiers. In the camp there are no helicopters or tanks but they have five land-rovers. The Junior Soldiers join at the age of sixteen. They get up at about 6.30 a.m.,have their breakfast at 7.00 a.m.They need to be very fit.When they are out they take a haversack,a gun,a water bottle,a sleeping bag,a ground sheet and a gas mask. It has now been decided that the Junior Soldiers are going to a new camp near Folkestone.The camp will remain in the hands of the army as a Territorial unit.
